title: The King's Singers by Request
description:
By Request - The King's Singers was released in 1983 and is in the Pop/Jazz genre, although "Can't buy Me Love" is done as a Madrigal!  This album is actually a compilation from their other albums.  Also, this album was often featured on The Tonight Show with Johnny Carson and the Today show when the group appeared on television in the United States.

This album is no longer available commercially but may be found on Amazon and eBay.  Some songs may be found on other albums.

Track listing
	1. Georgia On My Mind
	2. The Windmills Of Your Mind
	3. Because
	4. Can't Buy Me Love
	5. Three Times A Lady
	6. The Rhythm of Life
	7. Your Feet's Too Big	
	8. Short People
	9. Lazybones/(Up A) Lazy River
	10. Nina
	11. Hush Little Baby
	12. I love You Samantha
	13. What's In A Tune?

The King's Singers appearing on this album are:
	Nigel Perrin, Jeremy Jackman, and Alastair Hume - Counter Tenors
	Alastair Thompson and Bill (Greyston) Ives - Tenors
	Anthony Holt and Simon Carrington - Baritones
	Brian Kay - Bass

This was recorded from vinyl using Cool Edit Pro and saved as 320k mp3.  No editing was done except deleting silence before and after the song.

I apologize for the bad cover art, I could not find one that was of acceptible size and quality.

docfester
